article: When my oldest son was in high school, he planned to attend a Christian contemporary concert with the youth group from our church. To my  _  , Aaron invited me to go along. How many  _  would I have to do something fun with him  _  he went away to college? And how many youth actually  _  their mothers to attend a concert with them that was clearly for teens? I stood when the kids stood, clapped when they clapped, and never let anyone know how  _  I was to feel the floor vibrate beneath my feet. Aaron and his friends were  _  at my enthusiasm. By the time we left the concert, my ears were ringing, but it quickly passed.  _  did my son's teenage years.  In no time  he was in college and away from home. I missed him more than I could say. On days when I was especially  _  for his ready smile and his teasing manner, I would think back to the concert we attended and be thankful once again that I didn't  _  an opportunity to spend time with my son.
